recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
recipes.description: A classic Italian pasta dish made with spaghetti, eggs, pancetta or bacon, and cheese.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: Cook spaghetti in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente.
While pasta is cooking, beat eggs in a large bowl.
Fry pancetta or bacon in a large skillet until crisp, then drain on paper towels.
Add drained pasta to the skillet and toss with the pancetta or bacon to coat.
Remove from heat and pour egg mixture over the pasta, stirring quickly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
Add grated cheese and toss to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately, garnished with additional grated cheese and black pepper.

recipes.name: Roast Chicken
recipes.description: A classic roast chicken recipe that is simple to prepare and always delicious.
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels.
Rub chicken with olive oil and season generously with salt and pepper, inside and out.
Stuff the cavity of the chicken with lemon quarters and garlic cloves.
Tie the legs together with kitchen twine.
Roast the chicken in a roasting pan for about 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Let the chicken rest for 10-15 minutes before carving and serving.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
recipes.description: A healthy and flavorful stir-fry recipe that is perfect for a quick and easy weeknight dinner.
directions: Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat.
Add onion and garlic and stir-fry for 1 minute.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, mushrooms, carrots, and snow peas and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, until vegetables are crisp-tender.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, rice vinegar, honey, sesame oil, and red pepper flakes.
Add sauce to the skillet and stir-fry for 1-2 minutes, until vegetables are coated and heated through.
Serve stir-fry over rice or noodles.
